intro: Erodium amanum subsp. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered pink or purple flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Native to parts of southern Europe and western Asia, this species thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
